title: From East Coast Cliffs to Northern Wonders

image.alt: Powerful Dettifoss waterfall in North Iceland

quote.text: The world is full of magic things, patiently waiting for our senses to grow sharper.
quote.author: W.B. Yeats

summary: Begin at the dramatic sea cliffs of East Iceland before journeying to North Iceland's most powerful natural wonders. Experience Europe's mightiest waterfall, a horseshoe-shaped canyon, relaxing geothermal waters, and the historic 'Waterfall of the Gods' before arriving in Akureyri, Iceland's northern capital.

schedule.title: Breakfast at Ásgeirsstaðir Cottages
schedule.description: Self-catered breakfast at your cottage. Pack extra snacks and lunch provisions for the day's journey.

schedule.title: Ker Cliffs Hike
schedule.description: Take a beautiful 1.5-hour hike along the Þerribjörg Sea Cliffs, offering some of East Iceland's most breathtaking coastal views. The trail is relatively easy and suitable for most fitness levels.

schedule.title: Drive to Dettifoss
schedule.description: Long but scenic drive from East Iceland into the northern region. Take Road 864 to access Dettifoss from the east side, which offers the most impressive views.

schedule.title: Dettifoss Waterfall
schedule.description: Experience Europe's most powerful waterfall, a UNESCO World Heritage site. The falls are 328 feet wide and 148 feet high, creating an impressive display of raw natural power. The east-side viewpoint offers the most dramatic perspective.

schedule.title: Lunch Break
schedule.description: Enjoy a packed lunch near Dettifoss or at the visitor center facilities.

schedule.title: Ásbyrgi Canyon
schedule.description: Explore this remarkable horseshoe-shaped canyon with looping walking paths through lush greenery. According to Norse mythology, the canyon was formed by Odin's eight-legged horse, Sleipnir.

schedule.title: Mývatn Nature Baths
schedule.description: Relax in this geothermal lagoon, a less crowded alternative to the Blue Lagoon. The milky blue waters are rich in minerals and said to be beneficial for skin conditions. Facilities include steam rooms and a café.

schedule.title: Goðafoss Waterfall
schedule.description: Visit the 'Waterfall of the Gods,' where Iceland converted to Christianity in the year 1000. The crescent-shaped falls span 100 feet and offer easily accessible viewing platforms on both sides.

schedule.title: Check in at Akureyri Airbnb
schedule.description: Arrive at your Airbnb hosted by Hildur in Akureyri, Iceland's second-largest urban area and the 'Capital of the North.'

schedule.title: Late Dinner in Akureyri
schedule.description: Enjoy dinner at one of Akureyri's excellent restaurants. Recommendations include Rub23 for seafood and Strikið for Nordic cuisine with rooftop views.

highlights.title: Ker Cliffs
highlights.description: Dramatic sea cliffs and coastline in East Iceland, offering a perfect farewell to the eastern region with stunning ocean views.

highlights.title: Dettifoss Waterfall
highlights.description: Europe's most powerful waterfall and a UNESCO World Heritage site, showcasing the raw natural power of Iceland's glacial rivers.

highlights.title: Ásbyrgi Canyon
highlights.description: Unique horseshoe-shaped canyon rich in Norse mythology and featuring lush vegetation in an otherwise stark landscape.

highlights.title: Mývatn Nature Baths
highlights.description: Geothermal lagoon with mineral-rich waters, offering relaxation after a day of exploration and driving.

highlights.title: Goðafoss Waterfall
highlights.description: Historically significant 'Waterfall of the Gods' with a perfect semicircular shape and easy viewing access.

accommodation.name: Airbnb in Akureyri
accommodation.notes: Hosted by Hildur. Entire apartment gives you flexibility for evening meals and relaxation.

alternatives.title: Grjótagjá Cave
alternatives.description: Small lava cave with hot spring (viewing only, no swimming allowed). Featured in Game of Thrones.

alternatives.title: Hverfjall Crater Hike
alternatives.description: Dramatic volcanic crater with panoramic views. 2-mile loop around the rim (1 hour).

alternatives.title: Bergárfoss Waterfall
alternatives.description: Hidden gem: The prettiest and most secluded waterfall in North Iceland, rarely visited even by locals.

alternatives.title: Krafla Volcano Crater
alternatives.description: Huge 300-meter crater of the Krafla volcano with otherworldly landscapes.

alternatives.title: Námaskarð Geothermal Area
alternatives.description: Bubbling mud pools and colorful sulfurous terrain near Lake Mývatn.

alternatives.title: Dimmuborgir Lava Formations
alternatives.description: Dramatic lava field with unusual formations said to connect earth with the infernal regions.

badWeatherAlternatives.title: Akureyri Art Museum
badWeatherAlternatives.description: Contemporary art exhibits in Iceland's northern capital.

badWeatherAlternatives.title: Mývatn Nature Baths
badWeatherAlternatives.description: The nature baths are excellent in bad weather, with steam rising dramatically from the warm waters.

badWeatherAlternatives.title: Aviation Museum in Akureyri
badWeatherAlternatives.description: Learn about Iceland's aviation history with vintage aircraft and exhibits.

badWeatherAlternatives.title: Brynjuís Ice Cream in Akureyri
badWeatherAlternatives.description: Famous local ice cream shop. Icelanders love ice cream even in bad weather!

badWeatherAlternatives.title: Sigurhjörtur Wool Shop in Akureyri
badWeatherAlternatives.description: Traditional Icelandic wool products including sweaters, hats, and mittens.

tip: This is a long driving day, so start early and be flexible with your itinerary. The east access road (864) to Dettifoss offers more impressive views than the west side but can be rougher - your 4WD vehicle will handle it well.
notes: Weather in northern Iceland can differ significantly from eastern Iceland, so check forecasts and pack accordingly. Consider skipping some stops if time runs short - Dettifoss and Goðafoss should be priorities for waterfall enthusiasts. The Mývatn Nature Baths are a perfect midway relaxation point but may require advance booking in peak season.
